concept.title: BOUNDARY Command
concept.shortdesc: Creates closed polylines from bounding entities.

conbody.p: Create closed polylines, defined by surrounding entities. Options allow you to pick an internal point, specify the boundary set, and detect islands.

section.title: Boundary Dialog Box
section.p: Begin creating boundaries by selecting options in the Boundary dialog box.

dlentry.dd: Specify a point inside an enclosed area for which you want to create a boundary. You can continue picking additional points until you press Enter to return to the Boundary dialog box.
Specify the largest gap that can exist in the boundary for BricsCAD to consider the area closed. When boundary tolerance is 0, no gaps can exist.

Specify where BricsCAD should search for entities that make up the boundary.
Use Current View: Search all entities in the current viewport.
Use Boundary Set: Search only the current selection set.
New: Create a new selection set. Press Enter to finish selecting entities and return to the Boundary dialog box.
Specify island detection. An island is an enclosed area inside a boundary.
Treat every island as a boundary.
Create a boundary of only the outermost entities.
Ignore the innermost areas. A boundary is created between the outermost area and islands.

section.title: Options within the BOUNDARY command
section.p: After you begin creating boundaries, the following options may be available:

dlentry.dd: Select entities to use as boundaries.
Undo the last internal pick point and continue picking points to specify additional enclosed areas.
